item.title: [DELTA] Barrows Minigame
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“C++ Imbued, post:13, topic:434855”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=537572.msg3931407#msg3931407 date=1330718763]

/* Waken check */ public static boolean KARILS_AWAKE = false, AHRIM_AWAKE = false, DHAROCK_AWAKE = false, VERAC_AWAKE = false, GUTHAN_AWAKE = false, TORAG_AWAKE = false; /* Types */ public static int Ahrim, Verac, Dharok, Torag, Karils, Guthan, Barrows;

Please work on your conventions not only that this could be shortened by a lot. good job though.

That^ doesn’t have anything to do with conventions. Ive even informed on that in the past.
It doesn’t mather if you use a single line everytime or not it’s how you like it, and in my opinion it’s more organized to use single lines.
[/quote]
No It isn’t. it’s whether or not you want your code to look clean… how it’s done now it’s unprofessional and ugly…[/quote]
That’s what I am saying, it depends on how you like it, I think putting it in one line is ugly and unorganized. It’s a mather of opinions.
@my other conventions, working on that, I know they are far from good

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA] Barrows Minigame
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:11, topic:434855”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=537572.msg3931422#msg3931422 date=1330719764]

/* Waken check */ public static boolean KARILS_AWAKE = false, AHRIM_AWAKE = false, DHAROCK_AWAKE = false, VERAC_AWAKE = false, GUTHAN_AWAKE = false, TORAG_AWAKE = false; /* Types */ public static int Ahrim, Verac, Dharok, Torag, Karils, Guthan, Barrows;

Please work on your conventions not only that this could be shortened by a lot. good job though.

That^ doesn’t have anything to do with conventions. Ive even informed on that in the past.
It doesn’t mather if you use a single line everytime or not it’s how you like it, and in my opinion it’s more organized to use single lines.

Not that this matters at all, but I figured you’d like to learn something.

referring to:

public static boolean KARILS_AWAKE = false, AHRIM_AWAKE = false, DHAROCK_AWAKE = false, VERAC_AWAKE = false, GUTHAN_AWAKE = false, TORAG_AWAKE = false;

Normally, a variables name would be all capitals if it’s final.

so you would either want to have

public static final boolean KARILS_AWAKE = false, AHRIM_AWAKE = false, DHAROCK_AWAKE = false, VERAC_AWAKE = false, GUTHAN_AWAKE = false, TORAG_AWAKE = false;

or

public static final boolean karils_awake = false, ahrim_awake = false, dharok_awake = false, verac_awake = false, guthan_awake = false, torag_awake = false;

not that it matters… just thought i’d tell you.
[/quote]

Yes I know that I started with using em as finals,
but then I got some error that I had to remove the finals and I didn’t mind changing them again[/quote]
ah wierd.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:10, topic:434855”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=537572.msg3931407#msg3931407 date=1330718763]

/* Waken check */ public static boolean KARILS_AWAKE = false, AHRIM_AWAKE = false, DHAROCK_AWAKE = false, VERAC_AWAKE = false, GUTHAN_AWAKE = false, TORAG_AWAKE = false; /* Types */ public static int Ahrim, Verac, Dharok, Torag, Karils, Guthan, Barrows;

Please work on your conventions not only that this could be shortened by a lot. good job though.

That^ doesn’t have anything to do with conventions. Ive even informed on that in the past.
It doesn’t mather if you use a single line everytime or not it’s how you like it, and in my opinion it’s more organized to use single lines.
[/quote]

Not that this matters at all, but I figured you’d like to learn something.

referring to:

public static boolean KARILS_AWAKE = false, AHRIM_AWAKE = false, DHAROCK_AWAKE = false, VERAC_AWAKE = false, GUTHAN_AWAKE = false, TORAG_AWAKE = false;

Normally, a variables name would be all capitals if it’s final.

so you would either want to have

public static final boolean KARILS_AWAKE = false, AHRIM_AWAKE = false, DHAROCK_AWAKE = false, VERAC_AWAKE = false, GUTHAN_AWAKE = false, TORAG_AWAKE = false;

or

public static final boolean karils_awake = false, ahrim_awake = false, dharok_awake = false, verac_awake = false, guthan_awake = false, torag_awake = false;

not that it matters… just thought i’d tell you.
edit: last code you forgot final :p[/quote]

Yes I know that I started with using em as finals,
but then I got some error that I had to remove the finals and I didn’t mind changing them again

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA] Barrows Minigame
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[center]

[size=18pt][shadow=black,right]Quick tutorial for a descent barrows minigame for Delta.
By RandQm[/shadow][/size][/center]

[size=14pt]Introduction:[/size]
It’s since 06-07 that I played rs intensively so I’m not sure if I did everything 100% right.
But this should be pretty close to real rs barrows minigame.

[size=14pt]Contains:[/size]
[b]- 99% of the code handled in one class

  • Digging in hill to go to brother
  • Leaving again via stairs
  • After defeating the last brother you go to the tunnels
  • Follow the right way in the tunnels to get to the rewards chest
  • Get rewards (rewards like real rs, random generated with less chance for higher valuable items)[/b]

[size=14pt]To do yourself:[/size]
[b]- adding monsters in the tunnels

  • edit doors faces[/b]

[size=14pt]Let’s get started![/size]

STEP 1:
Delete everything that has to do with barrows from your source.

STEP 2:
This is to make the doors go open in the tunnels. You will have to edit them so they face right if it bothers you like how they are now.
It might also be possible that it’s already coded in your client class if you are using an older base to.

//BARROWS DOORS
door = 3568	9718	6735	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3569	9718	3735	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3534	9718	3716	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3535	9718	6735	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3541	9712	6719	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3541	9711	6738	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3534	9705	6737	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3535	9705	6718	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3528	9712	3736	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3528	9711	6717	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3534	9701	6718	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3535	9701	6737	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3535	9688	6726	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3534	9688	6745	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3534	9684	6726	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3535	9684	6745	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3528	9678	6736	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3528	9677	6717	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3541	9677	6748	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3541	9678	6729	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3545	9678	6748	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3545	9677	6729	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3551	9684	6727	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3552	9684	6746	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3552	9688	6727	-1	0	0	0	0
door = 3551	9688	6746	-1	0	0	0	0
//OTHER DOORS

STEP 3:
Time for the actual programming now.
Make a new java file called “Barrows”
If you don’t know how to make a new java file, just make a new text document and save it as Barrows.java

Now in Barrows.java add this code to it:
NOTE: I added some explanation into the code itself, if you still don’t understand things just send me a PM or reply and I’ll be glad to answer them.

public class Barrows { 
	
/**
 * @Author: RandQm
 * @Date: 2 March 2012
 * @Info: Barrows Minigame with the right rewards and reward-amounts.
 */
	
	/* Waken check */
	public static boolean KARILS_AWAKE = false;
    public static boolean TORAG_AWAKE = false;
    public static boolean AHRIM_AWAKE = false;
    public static boolean DHAROCK_AWAKE = false;
    public static boolean VERAC_AWAKE = false;
    public static boolean GUTHAN_AWAKE = false;
    /* Types */
    public static int Ahrim;
	public static int Verac;
	public static int Dharok;
	public static int Torag;
	public static int Karils;
	public static int Guthan;
	public static int Barrows; 
	
	/* Rewards */
	public static int HIGHBarrowRewards[] = {4710, 4718, 4712, 4720, 4726, 4728, 4734, 4736, 4747, 4749, 4755, 4757, 4714, 4722, 4730, 4738, 4751, 4759};
		public static int HIGHreward() { 
    	return HIGHBarrowRewards[(int)(Math.random()*HIGHBarrowRewards.length)];
    }
    public static int MEDIUMBarrowRewards[] = {4714, 4722, 4730, 4738, 4751, 4759, 4753, 4745, 4732, 4724, 4716, 4708, 1149};
    public static int MEDreward() { 
    	return MEDIUMBarrowRewards[(int)(Math.random()*MEDIUMBarrowRewards.length)];
    }
    public static int LOWBarrowRewards[] = {4753, 4745, 4732, 4724, 4716, 4708, 1149};
    public static int LOWreward() { 
    	return LOWBarrowRewards[(int)(Math.random()*LOWBarrowRewards.length)];
    }
    
    /**
     * @param playerId
     * @Info: Getting rewards when all brothers are defeated and resetting the minigame.
     */
    private static void getRewards(final int playerId) {
    	final Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId];
    	Barrows = 0;
		Verac = 0;
		Dharok = 0;
		Ahrim = 0;
		Torag = 0;
		Karils = 0;
		Guthan = 0;
		digIntoHill(playerId, 3564, 3288, 0);
		c.sM("You defeated barrows!");
		c.addItem(995, Misc.random(4162));
		c.addItem(4740, Misc.random(160));
		c.addItem(558, Misc.random(1430));
		c.addItem(562, Misc.random(687));
		c.addItem(560, Misc.random(391));
		c.addItem(565, Misc.random(159));
		if (Misc.random(5) == 5)
			c.addItem(HIGHreward(), 1);
		else if (Misc.random(5) == 4)
			c.addItem(MEDreward(), 1);
		else if (Misc.random(5) == 3 || Misc.random(5) == 2)
			c.addItem(LOWreward(), 1);	
		else if (Misc.random(5) < 2)
			c.addItem(129, 1);	
    }
	
	/**
	 * @param playerId
	 * @param Xc = x coordinates
	 * @param Yc = y coordinates
	 * @Info: Controlling the stairs for barrows minigame.
	 */
	private static void controlStairs (final int playerId, int Xc, int Yc) {
		final Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId];
		c.toX = Xc;
		c.toY = Yc;
		c.heightLevel = 0;
		c.killMyNPCs();
		c.resetfollowers();
	}
	
	/**
	 * @param playerId
	 * @param brotherName = The name of the barrows brother
	 * @param brother = The barrows brother type
	 * @param waken = Waking up the brother
	 * @param tX = X coordinates
	 * @param tY = Y coordinates
	 * @param tZ = Height
	 * @Info: Checking if you didn't already kill the brother. If not, spawning the brother.
	 */
	private static void barrowCheck (final int playerId, String brotherName, int brother, boolean waken, int tX, int tY, int tZ) {
		final Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId];
		if(brother == 1) {
			c.talk("You have already killed "+brotherName+" in this round!", 1078);
		}
		if (waken == true) {
			c.talk("You have already woken up "+brotherName+" in this round!", 1078);
		}
		if(brother == 0 && waken == false) {
			NPCHandler.spawnANPC(tX, tY, tZ, c.heightLevel);
			c.sM("You wake the ancient beast up!");
			waken = true;
		}
	}
	
	/**
	 * @param playerId
	 * @param objectId
	 * @Info: Putting the right actions for the right objects.
	 */
	public static void barrowObjects (final int playerId, int objectId) {
		final Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId];
		/* Stairs */
		if(objectId == 6702){
			controlStairs(playerId, 3565, 3289);
		}
		if(objectId == 6703){
			controlStairs(playerId, 3575, 3297);
		}
		if(objectId == 6704){
			controlStairs(playerId, 3577, 3282);
		}
		if(objectId == 6705){
			controlStairs(playerId, 3566, 3275);
		}
		if(objectId == 6706){
			controlStairs(playerId, 3553, 3282);
		}
		if(objectId == 6707){
			controlStairs(playerId, 3557, 3297);
		}
		/* Barrows brothers spawning */		
		if(objectId == 6823){ //3568 9710
			barrowCheck(playerId, "Verac", Verac, VERAC_AWAKE, 2030, 3575, 9705);
		}
		if(objectId == 6771){ // 3569 9694
			barrowCheck(playerId, "Dharok", Dharok, DHAROCK_AWAKE, 2026, 3556, 9717);
		}
		if(objectId == 6821) {
			barrowCheck(playerId, "Ahrim", Ahrim, AHRIM_AWAKE, 2025, 3557, 9700);
		}
		if(objectId == 6772){
			barrowCheck(playerId, "Torag", Torag, TORAG_AWAKE, 2029, 3568, 9687);
		}
		if(objectId == 6822){
			barrowCheck(playerId, "Karils", Karils, KARILS_AWAKE, 2028, 3552, 9684);
		}
		if(objectId == 6773){
			barrowCheck(playerId, "Guthan", Guthan, GUTHAN_AWAKE, 2027, 3540, 9705);
		}
		/* Reward chest */
		if(objectId == 10284){
			if(Verac == 1 && Dharok == 1 && Ahrim == 1 && Torag == 1 && Karils == 1 && Guthan == 1) {
				getRewards(playerId);
				c.sM("You search the chest and find some items!");
			} else
				c.sM("You need to kill all barrow brothers before searching for a reward.");
		}	
	}
	
	/**
	 * @param playerId
	 * @param x = x coordinate
	 * @param y = y coordinate
	 * @param z = height
	 */
	private static void digIntoHill (final int playerId, int x, int y, int z) {
		final Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId];
		//c.setAnimation(831);
		c.toX = x;
		c.toY = y;
		c.heightLevel = z;
	}
	
	/**
	 * @param playerId
	 * @param spadeId
	 */
	public static void digSpade(final int playerId, int spadeId) {
		final Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId];
		switch (spadeId) {
		case 952:
			/* Torags Hill */
			if(c.absX >= 3548 && c.absX <= 3557 && c.absY >= 3279 && c.absY <= 3287){
				digIntoHill(playerId, 3568, 9683, 3);
			}
			/* Veracs Hill */
			if(c.absX >= 3552 && c.absX <= 3561 && c.absY >= 3292 && c.absY <= 3303){
				digIntoHill(playerId, 3578, 9706, 3);
			}
			/* Dharocks Hill */
			if(c.absX >= 3570 && c.absX <= 3578 && c.absY >= 3293 && c.absY <= 3302){
				digIntoHill(playerId, 3556, 9718, 3);
			}
			/* Guthans Hill */
			if(c.absX >= 3573 && c.absX <= 3581 && c.absY >= 3278 && c.absY <= 3288){
				digIntoHill(playerId, 3534, 9704, 3);
			}
			/* Karils Hill */
			if(c.absX >= 3562 && c.absX <= 3568 && c.absY >= 3271 && c.absY <= 3278){
				digIntoHill(playerId, 3546, 9684, 3);
			}
			/* Ahrims & final Hill */
			if(c.absX >= 3561 && c.absX <= 3569 && c.absY >= 3284 && c.absY <= 3292){
				if(Verac == 1 && Dharok == 1 && Torag == 1 && Karils == 1 && Guthan == 1) {
				digIntoHill(playerId, 3557, 9703, 3);
			} else 
				c.sM("You need to kill all barrow brothers before getting a reward.");
			}
		}
	}
}

STEP 4:

You should see something like this:

			ItemSlot = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
			ItemID = inStream.readUnsignedWordBigEndian();

			lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();

Now search for packet 132, you should see something like this:

				break;

				println("Client hack detected!");
				break;
			}

Under that last bracket add this:

Barrows.barrowObjects(c.playerId, objectID);
